Unlock

Use the Unlock dialog box (Actions | Unlock) to unlock specific revisions of one or more versioned files or to unlock specific revisions of all versioned files in a project or project database. You can unlock by revision number, version label, or promotion group.

Locks placed on projects using Version Manager 5.3/6.0 are honored by the current version of Version Manager. Use Version Manager 5.3/6.0 to lock or unlock a 5.3/6.0 project.

Field Descriptions

General Tab
Unlock Locks by User: Select to unlock the revision(s) owned by an individual User, and then specify the User in the User edit field.

User edit field: Either enter the user name or click the Browse button to select it.

All users: Select to unlock the revision(s) owned by all Users.
Revisions

Revision: Select to unlock a specific revision of a versioned file by the specified User(s), and then specify the revision number or version label of the revision you want to unlock in the Revision edit field.

Revision Edit field: Either enter the revision number or version label of the revision you want to unlock or click the Browse button to select it. If you want to unlock by promotion group, you must click the Browse button to select it. If selecting the revision by a version label, enter a backslash before a version label that begins with a numeric character (such as \1.2label). Note: Default Revision is the latest revision of a versioned file. Default Revision, however, can be defined in the project's configuration file to be a version label or a specific revision number.

All revisions by selected User(s): Select to unlock all revisions of a versioned file owned by the specified User(s).

Include files in subprojects This field is only available if a project is selected. Select to unlock revisions in subprojects.
Selected Files Tab
Files List Review the revisions that you have selected to unlock.
Properties Click to display the Properties dialog box for either versioned files or projects.

See Also
